page.title: 11THE OLD RAILWAY
page.content: In the north of our block is a dis-mantled railway line. It was closed in September 1964.The last train to run on the line was an excursion to Blackpool.Mrs. Miflin, who is the dinner-time superintendent a Suckley School, rode on the foot- plate of the last train,between Suckley and Bromyard.The engine was a Class 22, double headed 2060 steam locomotive ,pulling five carriages. The line had been opened on the 1st.March 1878. It was later extended to Bromyard and then to Leominster. The line was closed due to reduced traffic and the increasing costs of maintenance.The closure was one of many ordered by Dr.Beeching, the then Minister of Transport. The rails have been taken up. The viaduct is still standing and the way is overgrown with weeds and saplings.
